definition: to turn a blind eye to

sentences.english: If you were still together , you're telling me you could just walk away from her?
sentences.chinese: 那若你們還在一起，你能對她視若無睹嗎？

sentences.english: Whoever closes their eyes to the past, will be blind to the present.
sentences.chinese: 對過去視若無睹的人也將瞽盲於現在。

sentences.english: Zhiqiu sometimes just stay middle aisle, the students will turn a blind eye.
sentences.chinese: 有時紙團剛好呆在過道中間，同學們就會視若無睹。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
